page.title: 02Ascott Home Farm Buildings
page.content: Ascott Home Farm is a farm in the grounds of Ascott House in Wing.Most of the buildings are Victorian. Ascott House was originally a hunting lodge. There is much woodland around the farm as it was used for shooting game. The main trees on the farm are pine, oak,lime and sycamore. Around the farmhouse, many of the farm buildings have been updated, such as the milking parlour. Also there are many sheds for the calves and living quarters for the cattle in winter. The farm is one mile away from Wing and is on a slope. At the bottom of it there is a stream. It is in the middle of the fields and farm buildings. These include silos, cows winter quarters, calving pens, waiting area, milking parlour, refrigerator, fodder store, calf shed, empty pens, bull pen, bull shed and slurry pit.
